page.title: 12Anvil Point Lighthouse
page.content: The most southerly tip of land in our study area is Anvil Point. Situated on limestone cliffs overlooking the English Channel is a lighthouse. It was built in 1881 by Trinity House and is now fully automatic, the light revolving every ten seconds. There is one principal keeper who lives on the site to maintain and oversee its working. The lighthouse is equipped with a fully automatic fog horn that can be heard up to a distance of eighteen miles away. There are many buildings surrounding the main tower and the whole area is enclosed by a white perimeter wall of about one and a half to two metres in height.
